citation.article-title: Psychromonas japonica sp. nov., Psychromonas aquimarina sp. nov., Psychromonas macrocephali sp. nov. and Psychromonas ossibalaenae sp. nov., psychrotrophic bacteria isolated from sediment adjacent to sperm whale carcasses off Kagoshima, Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Psychromonas macrocephali sp. nov.
Psychromonas macrocephali (mac.ro.ceph′a.li. N.L. gen. n. macrocephali of Physeter macrocephalus, the Latin name for the sperm whale).
Cells are rod-shaped; cell width ranges from 0.6 to 0.8 μm and cell length ranges from 2.2 to 2.9 μm.
Cells are Gram-negative and are motile by means of a single polar sheathed flagellum.
Colonies on MA are circular with entire edges, smooth, convex and cream-coloured.
Colonies on MA are 1.0–2.0 mm in diameter after 1–2 days of incubation at 20 °C.
The bacteria are psychrotrophic.
The optimal growth temperature is 20 °C.
Growth occurs at 0 °C and 25 °C, but not above 27 °C.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 3 % NaCl (w/v).
Growth occurs in the presence of 2 % and 6 % NaCl, but not without NaCl or in the presence of >7 % NaCl.
The optimal pH value for growth is pH 8.5.
Growth occurs at pH 6.0 and pH 9.0, but not at pH 5.5 or at greater than pH 9.5.
Facultatively anaerobic and capable of respiratory metabolism.
The cytochrome oxidase test is positive, but catalase is negative.
Does not produce H2S or indole.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but nitrite is not reduced.
Gelatinase, protease and DNase are positive, but amylase and lipase are negative.
Hydrolysis of Tween 20, Tween 40, Tween 80 and ONPG is positive.
Acid is formed oxidatively from d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, maltose, d-mannose and trehalose.
No acid is produced from l-arabinose, cellobiose, myo-inositol, d-lactose, d-mannitol, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose or xylose.
The G+C content of the DNA is about 41.5 mol% (determined by HPLC).
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-8.
The dominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 and C16 : 1.
The type strain, JAMM 0415T (=JCM 14785T=ATCC BAA-1527T), was isolated from the sediment adjacent to a sperm whale carcass off Kagoshima, Japan.
Strain JAMM 0700 is a reference strain.
